_header: Wit thou well that this book is leech
Note: Cf. 2688, of which this is the last eight lines; usually occurs with ‘Ipocras þis bok sende to þe emperour sesar’ preceding, and followed by a prose treatise on urines.
Subjects: introductions, to prose works; recipes, medical; medicine
_description: The Preface to a prose book of Medical Receipts — in couplets

BodDou84.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 95.

BLSl3285.First Lines:
Wytith wel this book is good lecheWith alle thynge that hit doth
                    tech…
BLSl3285.Last Lines:
…Now man tak thow right good ȝemeHou thou maist thi body
                    queme
BLSl3285.Note: 10 lines. Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
